title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 28 May 2013 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
00:01 <abusenius\_> has quit  
00:33 <rauds> has quit  
01:02 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:08 <abusenius\_> has quit  
01:10 <tekzilla> has quit  
01:21 <polx> has quit  
01:23 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
01:31 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
01:31 <SvenDowideit\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:36 <sdumitriu> has quit  
01:37 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
01:48 <Denis> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
07:49 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:50 <polx> has quit  
07:50 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:01 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
08:05 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:10 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <mflorea1> has quit  
08:20 <mflorea> has quit  
08:28 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:41 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <abusenius\_> has quit  
09:19 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:33 <rauds> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <rauds> @vmassol, @sburjan regarding the missing AS. I updated the 5.M1 to 5.02 with DW. worked excelent. Afterward i imported the xar file. Was also no problem. I didn't have the time to update every version step. I can check the each update step if I can help with it.  
09:41 <sburjan> rauds, so you are not able to reproduce the issue anymore ?  
09:43 <rauds\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <rauds\_> no. I will try it twice next time before starting a new thread here.  
09:44 <altker1281> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <altker1281> Hey all.  Anyone here using XWiki on Debian?  
09:44 <Denis> has quit  
09:44 <rauds> has quit  
09:47 <tmortagne> altker1281: yes  
09:47 <tmortagne> (ubuntu actually but it's pretty much the same from XWiki point of view)  
09:48 <altker1281> tmortagne: Have you messed with the Catalina opts stuff?  
09:53 <altker1281> tmortagne: For setting the memory usage of tomcat  
09:53 <tmortagne> altker1281: I did what is on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT#HTomcatUsability  
09:59 <altker1281> tmortagne: Any performance issues?  
10:00 <tmortagne> altker1281: not really but I don't have a huge load, you would look at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances  
10:01 <altker1281> yeah  
10:01 <altker1281> I've read all of that.  
10:01 <tmortagne> both xwiki.org and myxwiki.org are on debian but I'm not an expert of the tomcat setup applied there  
10:01 <altker1281> Gotcha.  
10:02 <tmortagne> you have performance issue all the time or on specific pages ?  
10:04 <altker1281> When I first set it up, I felt it was very slow to load pages.  but that was my old computer which rendered complex web pages slowly too  
10:04 <altker1281> I am going to re-setup XWiki since the first time I set it up I borked a few things  
10:05 <altker1281> But I wanted to get all the details right before doing it agian  
10:05 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
10:39 <vmassol> mflorea: where can I help on the build? (ie which ones are you handling?)  
10:39 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <vmassol> fixing http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-rest/  
10:45 <altker1281> Hi vmassol  
10:45 <altker1281> vmassol: BTW, thanks for helping me before you went on your break :)  
10:45 <altker1281> tmortagne: Helped me too :)  
10:47 <vmassol> altker1281: cool, don't remember what I did but glad it helped :)  
11:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: quick question, if I create a new module say xwiki-platform-help and move some XAR xml pages from xe-ui XAR to that new module, do I need to specify some EM metadata in the new pom for relocation of pages?  
11:05 <tmortagne> vmassol: there is no such metadata unfortunately for the xwiki-platform-help but you should add xwiki-platform-help id to XE-UI-ALL (to indicate that ui-all features xwiki-platform-help)  
11:05 <vmassol> ah  
11:06 <vmassol> so I need to do this also for the new xwiki-platform-user-directory addition in xe ui-all  
11:06 <vmassol> (what I committed a few days ago)  
11:06 <vmassol> checking pom for xe ui all  
11:06 <vmassol> indeed I missed that  
11:06 <tmortagne> yep, the import one to have in the ui-all list is ui but it's still good to have the others too in case some extension trigger it as dependency  
11:07 <tmortagne> s/import/important/  
11:07 <tmortagne> ideally it should be generated but I don't think you can modify the pom during the build  
11:08 <tmortagne> (well you probably could technically but it does not feel very Mavenish)  
11:09 <vmassol> pfew glad I asked, almost missed this one for 5.1M1 :)  
11:09 <mflorea> has quit  
11:11 <vmassol> guys can I commit the move of the help application in platform (it's just the syntax help pages ATM) that I moved from XE for 5.1M1? It doesn't seem dangerous. I can wait for 5.1M2 otherwise  
11:11 <vmassol> (the advantage is that it can be imported soon on e.x.o if released with M1)  
11:14 <vmassol> tmortagne: any pov?  
11:14 <vmassol> (since marius has left)  
11:15 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9175  
11:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: don't have anything against it  
11:16 <vmassol> tmortagne: hmm, I'll need to update the release scripts I guess for the translations import  
11:17 <vmassol> and update xwiki.org (that's easy)  
11:17 <vmassol> ok I'll do it  
11:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: you added a new translation file in l10n wiki ?  
11:19 <tmortagne> or I don't understand what you mean about updating the release script for translation  
11:20 <tmortagne> (I don't see anything new in http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/WebHome)  
11:20 <vmassol> that's what I meant tmortagne, thought it was in the script but it's on l10n apparently  
11:20 <vmassol> checking  
11:21 <tmortagne> ok you are talking about http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XWikiXWikiSyntax  
11:21 <tmortagne> ideally this page should be moved to http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/  
11:21 <vmassol> can I do a xwiki page move?  
11:21 <tmortagne> and yes you will ned to update the release scri  
11:22 <tmortagne> script  
11:22 <tmortagne> no  
11:22 <tmortagne> it's not that simple  
11:22 <tmortagne> each translation is its own page  
11:22 <tmortagne> I added a Move tool to l10n wiki  
11:23 <tmortagne> used it for ApplicationResources  
11:23 <tmortagne> which is now in Platform at last  
12:00 <vmassol> ok I'm done for the help application, hope I didn't forget something  
12:00 <vmassol> thanks for your help tmortagne  
12:01 <tmortagne> vmassol: np it's good test for refactoring stuff I added to l10n.xwiki.org, will move also wikimanager and appmanager after the release (enough changes already :))  
12:01 <vmassol> yep :)  
12:24 <tdelafosse> has quit  
12:25 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
12:32 <vmassol> hmm one more thing I need to do….  
12:32 <vmassol> related to the new user-directory module  
12:32 <vmassol> I need to: 1) create a new l10n module for translations  
12:33 <vmassol> 2) deprecate and move translation keys  
12:33 <vmassol> that's a pain  
12:33 <vmassol> for example I see:  
12:33 <vmassol>   <title>$services.localization.render('xe.userdirectory.title')</title>  
13:08 <alexch> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <rauds\_> has quit  
13:49 <sburjan> tmortagne,: what should I check for validating http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9153 ?  
13:49 <tmortagne> sburjan: the easiest is to install the debian package  
13:49 <tmortagne> the postgres one  
13:49 <tmortagne> well  
13:49 <sburjan> ok. because I didn't have any problems with the WAR  
13:50 <tmortagne> problem is that you can't do that easily with a snapshot  
13:50 <tmortagne> sburjan: you can't see the issue with the WAR  
13:50 <tmortagne> the issue is with generated hibernate file and you don't use a generated bibernate file  
13:51 <tmortagne> we don't have any other distribution that the debian one with postgres  
13:51 <tmortagne> so the way to test it is you build XWiki youself wth postgres profile  
13:53 <tmortagne> sburjan: actually it might be easy now to installe the debian snapshot package  
13:53 <sburjan> tmortagne, I always wondered myself, does the debian package has a direct dependency to the postgres package ?  
13:53 <tmortagne> jdeb is supposed to have improved snapshot support but did not tested it since  
13:53 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <sburjan> meaning if I don't have postgres installed, installing the xwiki package will also install postgres ?  
13:55 <tmortagne> sburjan: you can use "apt-cache show xwiki-enterprise-pgsql-common" to get details about a package  
13:56 <tmortagne> and yes if you don't have postgre it will be installed, the whole point is that when you install XWiki is just work  
13:58 <tmortagne> sburjan: you can add http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/xwiki-snapshots.list file to your /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ to install snapshot debian packages  
14:01 <sburjan> can someone tell me if this is in 4.5.4 ? http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8813 it seems  that Denis committed on the 4.5.x branch but he didn't add 4.5.4 fixVersion, and I want to make sure  
14:03 <tmortagne> sburjan: you will need Denis to really confirm but yes there is a related commit on 4.5 branch  
14:04 <tmortagne> in the meantime I'm pretty sure you can assume it's included in 4.5.4  
14:04 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
14:04 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
14:05 <sburjan> tmortagne, what about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-261 .Is it included in 4.5.4 ?  
14:06 <sburjan> Denis: ping  
14:06 <Denis> sburjan: ?  
14:06 <rauds> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <tmortagne> sburjan: I don't think it is  
14:07 <tmortagne> it was a dangerous refactoring for a stable branch  
14:07 <sburjan> Denis, regarding http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8813 .I see you committed in 4.5.x branch, but didn't put a fixFor for any version from the 4.5.x branch. Is it fixed in 4.5.4 ?  
14:07 <sburjan> tmortagne,: thanks  
14:11 <Slashman> hello, I have an issue with xwiki 5.0.2 (had the same on 5.0.1), when I try to export an article in pdf, I don't see the images anymore. it worked perfectly before on xwiki 4.5.x, any idea ?  
14:11 <Denis> :sburjan: I think it was  
14:12 <Denis> sburjan: I have updated the issue  
14:12 <Denis> sorry for the confusion  
14:12 <sburjan> Denis, no problem :)  
14:14 <Denis> tmortagne: It was not that much dangerous but a serious XEM issue  
14:16 <tmortagne> Denis: I was answering to sburjan about XRENDERING-261  
14:16 <tmortagne> Denis: I commented on the issue for XWIKI-8813  
14:24 <Slashman> so, no idea about my problem ? looking at the log, it tells me "ERROR o.a.f.a.FOUserAgent            - Image not found" when I export the document, but the link given by the error for the images works perfectly...  
14:30 <sburjan> Slashman: what do you mean by article ?  
14:31 <Slashman> sburjan: a wiki page  
14:31 <Slashman> I just try to do an export and there are no image in the resulting pdf  
14:33 <sburjan> Slashman: just a second, I'm gonna try to reproduce your issue with an image  
14:33 <rauds> has quit  
14:34 <Slashman> sure  
14:36 <Slashman> hm I found a page where it works, it may be linked to the multi-language wiki feature (only difference I can see between the 2 wiki page)  
14:37 <sburjan> so you are able to export the english(default) one but not the one in another language ?  
14:38 <Slashman> no, default is french and there is nothing here, english is the current page and when I export, the image in the english version are not exported in pdf  
14:38 <Slashman> on an other wiki page, only in french (default), export works correctly with all images  
14:39 <sburjan> ok, so exporting a document which is not the default language fails ?  
14:39 <Slashman> it works but the pdf does not contain any image  
14:41 <sburjan> Slashman: you should report an issue with the exact steps so I can try to see if it works for me  
14:42 <Slashman> sburjan: I just tried to remove the whole translation and recreated the page in the default language and I still have the same problem :'(  
14:42 <sburjan> Slashman: try with another image  
14:45 <Slashman> sburjan: tried with a new image, same problem  
14:45 <Slashman> sburjan: I'll try with a new document  
14:46 <sburjan> Slashman, I am not able to reproduce. It's either a faulty image, or a special document with some special content  
14:47 <sburjan> are you on a XE or XEM ?  
14:48 <Slashman> I'm using the xwiki Debian packaging, so XE I presume  
14:49 <Slashman> xwiki-enterprise 5.0.2  
14:49 <Slashman> btw, it works with a new document  
14:53 <vmassol> mflorea: what's your status on the functional tests? need any help?  
14:53 <vmassol> who's working on what re the build ATM?  
14:53 <vmassol> mflorea: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/ is still failing , you're on it?  
14:53 <mflorea> I'm looking at the wysiwyg tests now  
14:54 <sburjan> Slashman,: then the old document has something special which makes the export fail. I need more details to try to reproduce  
14:55 <mflorea> re webstandards, it's complicated, the placeholder attribute is nicer than withTip CSS class but it's HTML5.. Maybe we can enable HTML5 validation. Otherwise I'll switch back to withTip.  
14:56 <vmassol> how do we ensure it works also without HTML5?  
14:56 <vmassol> or do we want to support only browser versions supporting HTML5?  
14:56 <mflorea> I'm not sure what to do about the failing ui tests, due to the lost white space in XML attribute value. I tried XMLUtils.escapeXMLAttribute but it doesn't encode the white space  
14:56 <vmassol> I don't think we've ever talked about this  
14:57 <mflorea> yes, that's why I said it's complicated. Maybe I can add an exception for the placeholder attribute  
14:58 <vmassol> will it work with non html5 browsers?  
14:58 <mflorea> we have js to handle that  
14:58 <vmassol> (including voice only)  
14:58 <mflorea> voice only?  
14:58 <vmassol> WCAG  
14:59 <vmassol> we need users who use only voice over to operate the wiki  
14:59 <vmassol> (this is a use case of WCAG)  
15:00 <mflorea> I don't see how the placeholder can be used by the voice reader. But in any case, it's the same with withTip behavior  
15:01 <mflorea> it's even better because the platholder attribute is a stadnard, while the withTip class is our invention  
15:02 <vmassol> ok, I don't really know about the details of the use cases,  I just want to make sure our code works on the browser we support and WCAG support is not broken  
15:03 <vmassol> (as much as possible since the automated test we have for WCAG are far from enough unfortunately and we don't perform manual WCAG tests ATM :())  
15:03 <mflorea> it doesn't matter if the browser doesn't support the placeholder attribute, we have JS code that make sure the behaviour is similar  
15:03 <vmassol> ok  
15:04 <sburjan> @Devs: when you have the time, could you check http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9127 ?  
15:05 <vmassol> sburjan: indeed looks like a huge blocker  
15:05 <vmassol> I don't even understand how we released 5.0.2 without this TBH  
15:06 <sburjan> maybe because it didn't had a fixFox so no dev noticed it  
15:06 <vmassol> indeed blocker must ALWAYS have a fixfor  
15:06 <vmassol> otherwise it's not a blocker....  
15:06 <sburjan> ok, next time I report a blocker I'll ask a dev to put a "fixFor" for it  
15:07 <vmassol> yes  
15:07 <sburjan> I imagines it will get noticed.. but ..  
15:07 <sburjan> \*imagined  
15:07 <vmassol> so I'm proposing to put a blocker on 5.0.3 and 5.1M2 for now wdyt?  
15:07 <sburjan> I'm +1 if someone else besides me is able to confirm  
15:07 <vmassol> sburjan: manuel confirmed already  
15:10 <vmassol> sburjan: why did you say "update hibernate.cfg.xml" in the desc?  
15:10 <vmassol> what needs to be updated?  
15:11 <sburjan> I think that is redundant. I wanted to say "update hibernate.cfg.xml to use HSQLDB" but that is already the defaul AFAIR  
15:11 <vmassol> but you said to configure HSQLDB as the first step  
15:12 <vmassol> so why would you want to change the hib config?  
15:12 <vmassol> maybe you meant to say:  
15:12 <vmassol> don't overwrite your xwiki configuration files  
15:12 <vmassol> ?  
15:13 <sburjan> there are 2 waysof migrating HSQLDB: 1)you either replace the webapp (which I did), or move the database and data folder to another instance.  
15:14 <sburjan> "Put the 5.0.1 WAR in Jetty or Tomcat + HSQLDB jar + update hibernate.cfg.xml. Do not touch something else" <- means deploy inside the container the NEW version (5.0.1) and add the JAR to lib folder  
15:15 <vmassol> I've updated the issue  
15:15 <sburjan> thanks  
15:49 <vmassol> sburjan: when you say "import the ui-all XAR"  
15:49 <vmassol> it means I need to delete my data/database dir? Is this needed or can I skip this step?  
15:50 <vmassol> or should I import over the existing pages?  
15:50 <vmassol> also is it the XE ui-all or the XEM ui-all XAR?  
15:51 <sburjan> vmassol: I tried manager, so XEM ui-all  
15:51 <sburjan> and yes, I imported over the existing pages  
15:52 <sburjan> because initially you have no database since you're not using a packaged distro, but you deploy de WAR in the container  
15:52 <sburjan> so this is a little bit of an atypical setup for HSQLDB  
15:52 <vmassol> errr?  
15:53 <vmassol> you said: "Setup a XWiki 4.1.4 using Jetty + HSQLDB"  
15:53 <vmassol> you really need to improve your descriptios sorin  
15:53 <vmassol> and be a lot more precise  
15:53 <vmassol> because it's impossible to reproduce  
15:53 <vmassol> without asking 10 questions to you  
15:53 <vmassol> that takes a lot of time  
15:53 <vmassol> :)  
15:53 <sburjan> I was testing on TOmcat + HSQLDB and msmeria tested on Jetty + HSQLDB AFAIK  
15:53 <vmassol> also try to use to simplest config that fails  
15:53 <vmassol> that makes it simpler to reproduce and fix  
15:54 <vmassol> so what should I do now?  
15:54 <vmassol> can I use XE?  
15:54 <sburjan> according to msmeria yes  
15:55 <msmeria> vmassol: hi  
15:55 <msmeria> you can use XE  
15:55 <vmassol> msmeria: you imported the xe ui-all XAR over the existing db?  
15:55 <msmeria> I used the jetty-hsqldb version  
15:55 <msmeria> nope  
15:56 <vmassol> msmeria: can you edit the issue and explain how I can reprouce using XE?  
15:56 <vmassol> (or add a comment)  
15:56 <msmeria> sure  
15:56 <vmassol> thanks  
15:56 <msmeria> 1min  
15:56 <msmeria> np  
16:01 <msmeria> vmassol: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9127?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-75509  
16:03 <vmassol> thanks msmeria, trying  
16:03 <msmeria> yw  
16:06 <vmassol> msmeria: there are a few missing things in your steps  
16:06 <msmeria> like what ?  
16:06 <vmassol> first you kept the same data/ directory  
16:06 <vmassol> which means there's no db migration  
16:07 <vmassol> for ex, I get: "No data migration to apply for database [xwiki] currently in version [43000]"  
16:07 <vmassol> hmm forget this  
16:07 <vmassol> then I get the DW  
16:07 <vmassol> do I need to skip it or should I run it?  
16:07 <msmeria> run it  
16:08 <msmeria> I've edited my comment several times  
16:08 <vmassol> ok  
16:08 <vmassol> I'e refreshed  
16:08 <msmeria> :)  
16:10 <evalica> has quit  
16:14 <vmassol> msmeria: reproduced  
16:14 <vmassol> why does the issue say it's related to HSQLDB?  
16:14 <vmassol> did you test on another DB and it worked?  
16:15 <sburjan> sburjan: I tested on Postgres and I was not able to reproduce. See my comment from the issue  
16:15 <sburjan> vmassol,  ;)  
16:15 <sburjan> seem I am writing to myself  
16:15 <vmassol> ok  
16:15 <vmassol> I don't see the realtionship with the DB ATM  
16:16 <sburjan> let's hope there is one  
16:27 <msmeria> has quit  
16:27 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
16:31 <vmassol> sburjan: when you tried on pgsql  
16:31 <vmassol> you imported the ui-all XAR  right?  
16:31 <sburjan> vmassol: as far as I remember yes. I am now re-trying on MySQL  
16:31 <msmeria> has quit  
16:33 <vmassol> there's no DW in 4.1.4 anyway… :)  
16:33 <sburjan> yes :)  
16:38 <vmassol> ms   
16:38 <vmassol> sburjan/tmortagne: same problem on pgsql  
16:38 <vmassol> so the problem exists for all DBs  
16:39 <sburjan> vmassol: just worked on MySQL. I didn't lost my imported space before the migration  
16:40 <sburjan> let me comment on the issue  
16:40 <vmassol> you must be doing something different  
16:40 <sburjan> i was migrating to 5.1-SNAPSHOT  
16:40 <sburjan> not to 5.0.2  
16:40 <vmassol> I tested from 4.1.4 to 5.0.2 and following manuel's steps  
16:42 <mflorea> sdumitriu: ping  
16:42 <sdumitriu> Pong  
16:42 <sburjan> vmassol: reproducing on XEM + psql  
16:43 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yes?  
16:43 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Not me  
16:43 <vmassol> sdumitriu: indeed :)

16:44 <mflorea> wdyt about adding a "useTitleAsTip" CSS class name that would allow us to have a different placeholder than the initial/default value. You could write: <input type="text" value="$!escapetool.xml($request.param)" class="withTip useTitleAsTip" title="This is the placeholder"/>  
16:45 <sdumitriu> Hm... To overcome the validity issue?  
16:45 <mflorea> I can fix the validation tests this way because this use case was the main reason I had to use the placeholder attribute  
16:45 <mflorea> yep  
16:45 <sdumitriu> Sounds semantic to me, +1  
16:46 <mflorea> I need it for instance on search, where the initial value is the submitted search term, but I still want to display a placeholder when the input value is deleted  
16:46 <sdumitriu> But I wonder if it makes sense in general to leave the title in place or not  
16:46 <sdumitriu> We might have to rephrase a few tips to be good titles  
16:47 <mflorea> wait  
16:47 <mflorea> it's only one way, title -> tip  
16:47 <mflorea> why do you say we should rephrase the tips?  
16:47 <sdumitriu> I'm speaking in general  
16:48 <mflorea> you mean to use the title by default as tip?  
16:48 <sdumitriu> If we move the tip from value= to title=, and the title is still going to be displayed onhover by the browser, some of the tips that we're using now won't be meaningful as titles  
16:49 <sdumitriu> But we probably won't do this en-masse, anyway  
16:49 <sdumitriu> Just something to keep in mind when we decide to move a tip to the title  
16:52 <mflorea> yes. Note that I tried to change the doctype but it breaks all validation tests. We may need a new validator for HTML5. Also, I tested the HTML of the home page with the HTML5 doctype on w3c validator and there are a few errors, most of them related to the meta tags, "keywork is not registered" or something like that. So moving to HTML5 will require a bit of work, definitely not for 5.1M1
